issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I used the following steps:

1) Launch instance with monitoring bit enabled
2) Leave instance running (ensure EC2 metrics are showing)
3) After about a day, create and attach a volume

No EBS metrics are shown after 20 minutes of usage of the EBS volume.
fields.summary: CloudWatch: Not receiving EBS metrics after volume attachment

comments.body:
Below is a CC DescribeSensors response I am seeing on that system. Only the 4th instance (i-7BD646E9) has a volume. It has non-zero values and reasonable-looking timestamps for all metrics except one. I am seeing problem with dimension of VolumeQueueLength metric (it is 'vda' and 'vdf'), which must be related to EUCA-5773 (I'm curious if this code includes that fix).

{code}
$ egrep '(resourceName|metricName|dimensionName)' pretty-xml-of-describe-sensors-reply.txt | less

[~dmitrii]

System installed last night:
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.3.0
Release     : 0.0.798.20130422gite9dc4a97.el6
Size        : 2.4 M
Repo        : installed
From repo   : eucalyptus
Summary     : Elastic Utility Computing Architecture
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
License     : GPLv3
Description : Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
            : using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
            : with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
            : computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.
            :
            : This package contains the common parts; you will need to install at
            : least one of the cloud controller (cloud), cluster controller (cc),
            : node controller (nc), storage controller (sc), or walrus packages as well.

[root@eucahost-51-92 ~]#
I've been unable to reproduce this since the problem occurred.  [~viglesias], have you seen it lately?

[~ethomas]

I have not been able to reproduce this. Can you please close and I'll reopen if I see it again?
